thread.title: Granit Xhaka suggests Arsenal are on same level as Bayern Munich despite 10-2 defeat - social media has a field day
thread.title_full: Granit Xhaka suggests Arsenal are on same level as Bayern Munich despite 10-2 defeat - social media has a field day

author: Jake Polden
title: Granit Xhaka suggests Arsenal are on same level as Bayern Munich despite 10-2 defeat - social media has a field day
text:
Granit Xhaka claims Arsenal are on the same level as Bayern Munich (Photo: PA Wire) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Well, you have to admire the confidence of Granit Xhaka. 
The Arsenal midfielder played in both games against Bayern Munich, as the north London side crashed out the Champions League in embarrassing circumstances. 
At the Allianz Arena the Gunners were battered 5-1 in the first leg of their last-16 tie. 
While in the second leg at the Emirates, they again conceded five goals, meaning they lost the tie 10-2 on aggregate. 
To put it into perspective, the defeat was the worst suffered by an English team in the history of the Champions League. Xhaka played in both defeats to the German giants (Photo: REUTERS) 
Not only that, the second leg was Arsenal's biggest home defeat since 1998, so it's pretty safe to say they were well and truly outclassed by a much better team. 
Xhaka begs to differ however, much to the amusement of the world. Arjen Robben takes on Xhaka at the Emirates (Photo: AFP) 
The midfielder recently spoke to Swiss-German daily publication Blick, where he made a suggestion to end all wild suggestions. 
"I feel so [Arsenal are as good as Bayern]. And I am annoyed by the defeats mainly because I have good memories of Bavaria." Arsenal were beaten 10-2 on aggregate in the last-16 of the Champions League (Photo: AMA/Getty) 
We were able to beat the Munich team three times with Gladbach. And I do not think Gladbach is on par with Arsenal. So..." 
Predictably his comments were well-received on Twitter, with many poking fun at the claim: 
Xhaka defended his under-fire boss Arsene Wenger this week, suggesting people have forgotten his history of success. He added that he believes the Gunners will win the title soon. 
"I only know that he is an outstanding coach, an outstanding guy, enormously open and direct," said the Swiss. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
